conclusion: Determine the velocity v of ions after passing through the velocity selector and charge-to-mass ratio q/m of ions selected by the magnetic analyzer.

In the velocity selector, ions experience both electric and magnetic fields. Electric field E is directed vertically upwards, and magnetic field B is directed outward perpendicular to the plane of the paper. Ions are moving horizontally.
Force due to electric field is F_E = qE.
Force due to magnetic field is F_B = qvB.
For ions to pass through the velocity selector undeflected, electric and magnetic forces must balance: qE = qvB.
Solving for v gives v = E/B.
In the magnetic analyzer, ions follow a circular path due to the magnetic field.
Radius r of the circular path is r = mv/qB.
Ions pass through a quarter-circular ring with inner radius R_1 and outer radius R_2.
Ions that pass through the magnetic analyzer must have a radius r such that R_1 <= r <= R_2.
Substituting v = E/B into the equation for r gives r = mE/qB^2.
For ions to be selected by the magnetic analyzer, their radius r must satisfy R_1 <= mE/qB^2 <= R_2.
Rearranging to solve for q/m gives q/m <= E/(R_1 B^2) and q/m >= E/(R_2 B^2).
Charge-to-mass ratio q/m of ions selected by the magnetic analyzer must satisfy E/(R_2 B^2) <= q/m <= E/(R_1 B^2).
Final answer for velocity v is v = E/B.
Final answer for charge-to-mass ratio q/m is E/(R_2 B^2) <= q/m <= E/(R_1 B^2).
